filmography.title: Four Daughters
filmography.role_description: A cynical, fatalistic musician who disrupts the lives of a happy musical family; Garfield's electrifying screen debut.
filmography.plot: A happy family of four musical daughters has their lives turned upside down by the arrival of a cynical, brilliant young composer.

filmography.title: They Made Me a Criminal
filmography.role_description: A boxing champion falsely accused of murder who flees to Arizona and finds redemption on a ranch for wayward boys.
filmography.plot: A boxer flees to a date farm in Arizona after thinking he has killed a reporter, where he falls in love and helps delinquent youths.

filmography.title: Blackwell's Island
filmography.role_description: A crusading reporter who gets himself sent to prison to expose the corruption of a gangster running the jail.
filmography.plot: A reporter investigates a crime boss who is running a prison from the inside like a luxury hotel.

filmography.title: Juarez
filmography.role_description: A fiery Mexican revolutionary and future president who fights alongside Benito Juarez against French rule.
filmography.plot: Mexican President Benito Juarez fights the French occupation and the puppet Emperor Maximilian.

filmography.title: Daughters Courageous
filmography.role_description: A cynical fisherman's son who courts one of four sisters, mirroring his role in 'Four Daughters' with a different twist.
filmography.plot: A wayward father returns to his family after 20 years, complicating his daughters' lives and his wife's remarriage plans.

filmography.title: Dust Be My Destiny
filmography.role_description: An embittered ex-convict who marries a farm girl and goes on the run, struggling to escape his past.
filmography.plot: A misfit and his wife go on the run from the law, trying to find happiness despite the world being against them.

filmography.title: Castle on the Hudson
filmography.role_description: An arrogant, unrepentant gangster who maintains his swagger even while on death row.
filmography.plot: A hardened criminal enters Sing Sing prison and forms a complex relationship with the progressive warden.
filmography.awards: Remake of 20,000 Years in Sing Sing

filmography.title: Saturday's Children
filmography.role_description: An idealistic dreamer and inventor who struggles with the financial realities of marriage during the Depression.
filmography.plot: A young couple struggles to make ends meet and keep their romance alive amidst financial hardships.

filmography.title: Flowing Gold
filmography.role_description: A fugitive who finds work in the oil fields and tries to clear his name while falling for his boss's daughter.
filmography.plot: A man on the run for murder hides out in the oil fields, proving his worth as a roughneck.

filmography.title: East of the River
filmography.role_description: A gangster who tries to keep his adopted brother on the straight and narrow path.
filmography.plot: Two adopted brothers grow up on opposite sides of the law in New York City's Little Italy.

filmography.title: The Sea Wolf
filmography.role_description: A rebellious, resentful sailor who clashes with the tyrannical Captain Wolf Larsen aboard a seal-hunting ship.
filmography.plot: Survivors of a ferry collision are rescued by a brutal sea captain who holds them captive on his ship.

filmography.title: Out of the Fog
filmography.role_description: A smooth-talking racketeer who extorts two elderly fishermen, representing the menace of organized crime.
filmography.plot: Two fishermen are terrorized by a gangster demanding protection money, leading them to consider desperate measures.

filmography.title: Dangerously They Live
filmography.role_description: A young doctor who gets entangled with a British spy and Nazi agents in New York City.
filmography.plot: An intern at a hospital becomes involved with a woman claiming to be a British agent with vital war information.

filmography.title: Tortilla Flat
filmography.role_description: A simple paisano who inherits two houses, leading to complications with his friends in this Steinbeck adaptation.
filmography.plot: A group of poor but carefree friends in Monterey, California, navigate life, love, and wine when one of them inherits property.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Frank Morgan)

filmography.title: Air Force
filmography.role_description: A cynical, disgruntled gunner on a B-17 bomber who finds his patriotism after the attack on Pearl Harbor.
filmography.plot: The crew of a B-17 bomber flies into the attack on Pearl Harbor and fights across the Pacific.

filmography.title: The Fallen Sparrow
filmography.role_description: A Spanish Civil War veteran suffering from PTSD who is hunted by Nazis in New York City.
filmography.plot: A survivor of torture in the Spanish Civil War returns to New York to find the Nazi spies who killed his friend.

filmography.title: Destination Tokyo
filmography.role_description: A brash, womanizing submarine crewman who proves his bravery during a dangerous secret mission.
filmography.plot: A US submarine is sent on a secret mission to Tokyo Bay to gather intelligence for the Doolittle Raid.

filmography.title: Between Two Worlds
filmography.role_description: A cynical journalist who realizes he and his fellow passengers on a mysterious ocean liner are actually dead.
filmography.plot: Passengers on a fog-shrouded ship slowly realize they are traveling between life and the afterlife.

filmography.title: Pride of the Marines
filmography.role_description: The real-life Marine hero who was blinded at Guadalcanal and struggles to adjust to civilian life and disability.
filmography.plot: The true story of Al Schmid, a Marine blinded in combat who must overcome his bitterness and accept the love of those around him.

filmography.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
filmography.role_description: A drifter who engages in a passionate, doomed affair with a married woman, leading to murder and betrayal.
filmography.plot: A drifter working at a roadside diner and the owner's wife hatch a plan to murder her husband.

filmography.title: Nobody Lives Forever
filmography.role_description: A con man who plans to swindle a wealthy widow but ends up falling in love with her.
filmography.plot: A con artist returning from the war intends to fleece a rich widow, but his plans change when he develops feelings for her.

filmography.title: Humoresque
filmography.role_description: A brilliant violinist from the slums who becomes entangled in a destructive relationship with a wealthy, neurotic patroness.
filmography.plot: A talented violinist rises from poverty to fame, but his obsessive relationship with a wealthy socialite threatens his career.

filmography.title: Body and Soul
filmography.role_description: An ambitious boxer who compromises his ethics for success, becoming a champion but losing his soul in the process.
filmography.plot: A boxer rises to the top of his profession but loses his integrity and friends along the way.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Film Editing

filmography.title: Gentleman's Agreement
filmography.role_description: A Jewish army captain and friend to the protagonist who faces the harsh realities of anti-Semitism in post-war America.
filmography.plot: A reporter poses as a Jewish man to uncover anti-Semitism in New York City and the affluent suburbs.

filmography.title: Force of Evil
filmography.role_description: A corrupt lawyer for the numbers racket who faces a moral crisis when his schemes threaten his own brother.
filmography.plot: An unscrupulous lawyer works for a gangster to consolidate the numbers racket, leading to tragedy for his brother.

filmography.title: We Were Strangers
filmography.role_description: An American revolutionary who helps a group of Cuban rebels plot to overthrow a corrupt government.
filmography.plot: In 1933 Cuba, revolutionaries plot to assassinate a corrupt government official and blow up his funeral.

filmography.title: Under My Skin
filmography.role_description: A disgraced jockey and father who tries to regain his son's respect while dealing with mobsters in Europe.
filmography.plot: A jockey fleeing mobsters takes his young son to Europe, where he tries to make a clean start.

filmography.title: The Breaking Point
filmography.role_description: A desperate fishing boat captain who gets drawn into smuggling to support his family; a faithful adaptation of Hemingway.
filmography.plot: A charter boat captain facing financial ruin is tempted into smuggling illegal immigrants.

filmography.title: He Ran All the Way
filmography.role_description: A paranoid cop killer who takes a family hostage in their apartment; Garfield's final film role before his untimely death.
filmography.plot: A thief on the run takes a family hostage in their apartment, developing a complex relationship with the daughter.
